main event: A civilian observed a large, circular, reddish-orange object hovering and moving slowly in the sky over Roscoe, New York on August 5, 1961.
interesting points: The object was silent and hovered in the sky for several minutes.
The object suddenly disappeared after moving from the northeast to the east.
The witness had never seen anything like this before and requested further investigation.
The report was forwarded from the Department of the Navy's Bureau of Naval Weapons to the Department of the Air Force for handling.

The Air Force responded that while the observations were of interest, they did not provide conclusive evidence the object was of extraterrestrial origin, as there are many natural and man-made objects that can move in an unusual manner.
